7f841276-07f8-4ee3-aeef-d8d2ef4a0cae.description: In completing the Dean's Teaching Certificate, this individual developed an understanding of evidence-based teaching practices, implemented and assessed new teaching strategies, and engaged in sustained reflection on their teaching. Through a series of workshops and directed actions, they have built a foundational knowledge of learner-centered practices and made specific changes in their pedagogy or lesson designs in order to incorporate those strategies that have been shown to improve learning.
7f841276-07f8-4ee3-aeef-d8d2ef4a0cae.name: Dean's Teaching Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the foundational workshop "Frameworks for student learning" that considers how frameworks help student to become better organizers and constructors of knowledge. As part of workshop completion, identify an activity or discussion for implementation in class that will help students develop a framework for the course; and identify specific ways of assessing the success of the activity or activities.

Complete the foundational workshop " Student engagement and motivation" that focuses on strategies for promoting student engagement. Identify strategies to: 1) increase student perceived value , 2) develop student expectancies for success, and 3) create a supportive learning environment.

Complete the foundational workshop "Creating an inclusive classroom" that focuses on strategies for fostering inclusivity and granting students a voice. Identify specific strategies for implementation in the classroom to increase students feeling of inclusion.

Complete the foundational workshop "Designing and planning a course's learning activities" that considers methods for designing and assessing course activities that are aligned with the desired course outcomes. Provide written reflection on a current course and suggest ways to improve activity and assessment design for greater outcome alignment.

Complete the foundational workshop "Assessing for student learning" which focuses on methods for assessing learning to inform teaching practice. Identify specific assessment strategies to implement within your course.

Complete five elective experiences tied to teaching and learning. Elective experiences may include specific workshops, discussions or other developmental activities. For each elective experience, submit a reflective written summary that identifies specific takeaways from the experience and how they will be applied in your course(s).
Implement a best practice - Identify an evidence-based strategy to improve learning in your course, implement the strategy, and submit a reflective implementation retrospective.

Complete a professional development observation process that includes a pre-observation conference with a peer instructor to identify specific areas of focus for the observation, and a post-observation conference to receive feedback.

Develop a statement of teaching philosophy that includes concrete illustrations of pedagogical methods and addresses key themes of the Dean's Teaching Certificate program such as student motivation, inclusivity, structure and assessment.

681a0d71-c713-40b7-89d0-fff6843e0aae.description: In completing the Course Director Workshop, this individual demonstrated an understanding of evidenced based course-design practices, implemented observable and measurable objectives, evaluated the alignment of objectives with assignments, learning activities and assessments. This individual identified ways to improve inclusive practices in their course. Through a series of online, asynchronous modules, and directed actions, this individual achieved foundational knowledge of good course design.
681a0d71-c713-40b7-89d0-fff6843e0aae.name: Course Director Workshop

badge_template_activities.title: Complete module 1: “Creating learning objectives”. Complete assigned readings that explain the levels in Bloom’s cognitive domain taxonomy. Respond to one discussion question and post comments to the responses of at least two other participants. Rewrite existing course and lesson objectives to be measurable and observable, and to achieve higher levels in Bloom’s taxonomy. Review a course for alignment and integration of learning activities and assessments with stated learning objectives.

Complete module 2: “Creating Meaningful Assessments and Writing Effective Test Questions” Respond to one discussion question and post comments to the responses of at least two other participants. Identify effective and ineffective quiz questions. Review and revise quizzes for alignment with learning objectives.

Complete module 3: “Inclusive practices”. Respond to one discussion question and post comments to the responses of at least two other participants. Identify inclusive teaching practices to create a greater sense of belonging in the classroom. Identify strategies that make the design of a course more inclusive.

Complete module 4: “Learning Centered Teaching”. Respond to one discussion question and post comments to the responses of at least two other participants. Revise and or create learning activities to be learning-centered and engaging (active learning). Revise syllabi to be learning-centered and more visually inviting.

Complete module 5: “The Leader of Character Framework”. Respond to one discussion question and post comments to the responses of at least two other participants. Identify ways to incorporate USAFA’s Leader of Character Framework into courses.

625da474-7f4a-4d1c-a513-6dd0e30184ce.description: In earning this badge, these individuals served as faculty at the USAF Academy teaching undergraduate courses. Through this experience, 9H000s successfully managed all classroom administration to include lesson plan development, instruction, student evaluation, and academic remediation. 9H000s demonstrated the capability to mentor, teach, and inspire cadets to become officers of character in service to the nation in and out of the classroom.
625da474-7f4a-4d1c-a513-6dd0e30184ce.name: 9H000: Academic Faculty Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: Hold a Master's Degree or higher from an accredited institution of higher learning which is accepted by one of the USAF Academy's 20 academic departments.
Complete USAF Academy's New Faculty Orientation to gain the understanding and skills to effectively teach at the Academy and operate in a shared governance model.
Instruct at least one undergraduate course at the USAF Academy for a minimum of two semesters.
Create a supportive and challenging learning environment for cadets which promotes professionalism, reflective practice, self-assessment and lifelong learning.
Use multiple indicators to monitor and evaluate student progress and to inform planning and instructional processes
Conduct extra instruction to meet student's need and ensure achievement of course milestones.

Complete the professional development observation process. This includes a pre-observation conference with a peer instructor to identify specific areas of focus for the observation and a post-observation conference to receive feedback.
Receive a formal recommendation from the 9H000 Functional Manager for the award of the 9H000: Academic Faculty Instructor badge.

eb9ba5b0-464e-463b-a14e-7794a3ed2a51.description: Participants in the Mastery of Teaching Certification Community (MTCC) engage in a two-year program of professional development culminating in a personal teaching project in order to earn the Mastery of Teaching Certificate. Participants engage in intentional development opportunities that align with expectations set forth for academic promotion at the US Air Force Academy.
eb9ba5b0-464e-463b-a14e-7794a3ed2a51.name: Mastery of Teaching Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete at least one year of full-time work at the US Air Force Academy that includes a teaching assignment of at least one course.
Complete at least three years of teaching experience at the college level.

Participate in a two-year, faculty learning community - the Mastery of Teaching Certification Community. Community members are expected to read assigned literature, provide support to other members of the community through feedback and engage in sustained discussions regarding pedagogy and the development of effective learning environments.

Complete a Scholarly Teaching or a Scholarship of Teaching and Learning (SoTL) research project proposal. Both tracks requires a formal proposal that includes background literature as well as descriptions of the projects' research methods and assessment processes. The SoTL project requires a formal ethics review. A similar amount of time investment is required for both tracks.

Engage in a classroom observation process through video recording and/or peer observation. Develop personal goals for observable classroom behaviors based on the literature as a focus for the observations.

Engage in ongoing reflection that allows for immediate reaction to teaching experiences as well as the development of connections across multiple experiences. Document reflections and plans in an evidence file or portfolio that may later contribute to an academic promotion package.

Present ideas and project results to the larger USAF Academy community through formally provided opportunities. At least once each year, lead a discussion of innovative ideas and teaching practices that emerge from the MTCC learning community.
During the second year of the MTCC program, prepare and present a formal academic poster summarizing the Scholarly Teaching or SoTL research project.

c62eeafd-9a2c-4ea4-8794-9532257b8783.description: The Innovation in Assessment Recognition honors one faculty member annually who demonstrates a commitment to continuous educational improvement through the use of innovative assessment practices and exemplary usage of data. The winners of this recognition employ actions that promote data-informed decision-making, utilize research-based assessment practices, foster responsible use of data in order to improve the student academic experience, and enhance the quality of their courses or programs.
c62eeafd-9a2c-4ea4-8794-9532257b8783.name: Innovation in Assessment Recognition

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain a nomination from a colleague and endorsement of the department chair.

Submit a set of three to five artifacts that demonstrate innovation in assessment practices. Artifacts may include: formative or summative assessment tools developed for an academic course, lesson plans with detailed assessment strategies; reports or meeting minutes that demonstrate innovative use of assessment. Include an explanation describing the implementation of the innovation and reasoning behind the decision.

Provide evidence of the impact of innovations in assessment practice. Evidence may include: Data from course assessments, pre-and post-assessment scores; faculty or student survey data, longitudinal assessment data. Evidence of of impact should demonstrate how data are used in a complete cycle, where data are used to identify areas for change and then the impact of the changes is evaluated

Be selected from the pool of team and individual applicants based on evaluation by a committee of faculty members focused on the following criteria: 1) evidence of a pattern of innovative assessment; 2) effective use of multiple data sources for making decisions 3) closing the assessment loop on determining the impact of changes; and 4) potential for positive impact on colleagues’ assessment practices.

4b2257df-651e-4396-a6bc-c4a4a38cd796.description: The Excellence in Inclusive Teaching Recognition honors one faculty member annually for their outstanding commitment to diversity and inclusion in and outside the formal learning environment. Such individuals take actions to enhance inclusivity, encourage diverse perspectives, foster awareness of diversity issues and promote cultural competence and a global perspective. They advance a learning environment that is, collaborative, welcoming, and respectful.
4b2257df-651e-4396-a6bc-c4a4a38cd796.name: Excellence in Inclusive Teaching Recognition

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain a nomination from a colleague and endorsement of the department chair.

Complete an application including a digital portfolio of artifacts (e.g., lesson plans, syllabi, assignment directions, presentation materials) that illustrate and capture the nominee's inclusive teaching practices.

Be selected from the pool of applicants based on evaluation by a committee of faculty members that considers: 1) specific, varied and unique actions taken that enhance a sense of inclusivity, respect and belonging; 2) incorporation of a broad range of ideas, identities and voices from underrepresented groups in order to foster an inclusive community; and 3) Intentional effort to encourage diverse perspectives, foster diverse perspectives and promote cross-cultural understanding.

5856056d-86a4-4ede-b3a0-f76b12cdd4ed.description: The Innovative Teacher Recognition honors one faculty member annually who demonstrates a pattern of teaching practice defined by active inquiry into those techniques and strategies that enhance student learning. Such individuals demonstrate a scholarly understanding of a broad array of pedagogies, a history of experimenting with new approaches in the classroom, and a habit of reflecting upon evidence of the effectiveness of those approaches.
5856056d-86a4-4ede-b3a0-f76b12cdd4ed.name: Innovative Teacher Recognition

badge_template_activities.title: Obtain a nomination from a colleague and endorsement of the department chair.

Complete an application including a set of artifacts (e.g., lesson plans, syllabi, assignment directions, presentation materials) that demonstrate innovation in the classroom as well as evidence of impact of those innovations (e.g., student feedback, assessments, student work).

Be selected from the pool of applicants based on evaluation by a committee of faculty members for 1) evidence of a pattern of innovative teaching, 2) positive impact on student learning engagement or motivation and 3) potential for impact on colleagues' teaching practices.

3b235529-2ae6-4186-9dea-77d673d623e2.description: The Innovation in Assessment- Team Recognition honors members of a team of faculty demonstrating a commitment to continuous educational improvement through the use of innovative assessment practices and exemplary usage of data. The winners of this recognition work collaboratively to employ actions that promote data-informed decision-making, and utilize research-based assessment practices in order to improve the student academic experience, and enhance the quality of their courses or programs.
3b235529-2ae6-4186-9dea-77d673d623e2.name: Innovation in Assessment - Team Recognition

badge_template_activities.title: As a team, obtain a nomination from a colleague and endorsement of the department chair.

As a team, submit a set of three to five artifacts that demonstrate innovation in assessment practices. Artifacts may include: formative or summative assessment tools developed for an academic course, lesson plans with detailed assessment strategies; reports or meeting minutes that demonstrate innovative use of assessment. Include an explanation describing the implementation of the innovation and reasoning behind the decision.

As a team, provide evidence of the impact of innovations in assessment practice. Evidence may include: Data from course assessments, pre-and post-assessment scores; faculty or student survey data, longitudinal assessment data. Evidence of of impact should demonstrate how data are used in a complete cycle, where data are used to identify areas for change and then the impact of the changes is evaluated

Be selected from the pool of team and individual applicants based on evaluation by a committee of faculty members focused on the following criteria: 1) evidence of a pattern of innovative assessment; 2) effective use of multiple data sources for making decisions 3) involvement of a broader group of faculty in the assessment process, 4) closing the assessment loop on determining the impact of changes and 5) potential for positive impact on colleagues’ assessment practices.
